spcoursework.semanticanalyser

Class SemanticAnalyser

  • java.lang.Object
    • spcoursework.semanticanalyser.SemanticAnalyser

  • public class SemanticAnalyser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a semantic analyzer that is used for semantic analysis of the source file.
    Author:
    Roman Zakolenko

    • Method Detail

      • getSyntaxAnalyser

        public SyntaxAnalyser getSyntaxAnalyser()

      • scan

        public Node scan()
          throws SyntaxException,
                 LexException,
                 SemanticException
        The method that analyzes the source file for semantic errors
        Returns:
        object of class Node, root of the parse tree
        Throws:
        LexException - if during the lexical analysis is found unexpected character
        SyntaxException - if during the syntax analysis is found unexpected symbol or constructions
        SemanticException - if during the semantic analysis is found semantic errors

      • checkTags

        public boolean checkTags(int tag1,
                         int tag2)
        This method will test types of identifier and expression for compatibility
        Parameters:
        tag1 - type of identifier
        tag2 - type of expression
        Returns:
        true, if two types compatible, false, otherwise

      • checkTagsExpr

        public boolean checkTagsExpr(int tag1,
                             int tag2)
        This method will test types of two subexpression in expression for compatibility
        Parameters:
        tag1 - type of first subexpression
        tag2 - type of second subexpression
        Returns:
        true, if two types compatible, false, otherwise

      • check

        public int check(Node root)
          throws SemanticException
        The method which is called recursively for the nodes of the parse tree and analyze it for semantic errors (type mismatch)
        Parameters:
        root - root of the parse tree
        Returns:
        value of type of node(root)
        Throws:
        SemanticException - if during the semantic analysis is found semantic errors
